    Team News

    Valencia
    Real Madrid
    • Ricardo Costa could miss this one after straining his hamstring last weekend.
    • Valencia sacked Miroslav Djukic during the week and Nico Estevez has replaced him for now.
    • Real Madrid are without two of their preferred centre halves with Raphael Varane still out injured while Pepe is suspended.
    • Sergio Ramos, it is hoped, will be fit enough to play though there are minor doubts about his fitness. The defender is available too, despite his red card last weekend. The Competition Commission rescinded one of his cautions at El Sadar so, provided he proves his fitness, he will be available to play.
    • During the week there were also concerns over Cristiano Ronaldo's fitness. but the Portuguese is available.
    %>

    Prediction

    • Valencia have not had the ideal lead up to such a big game with the board deciding to relieve Miroslav Djukic of his post and Nico Estevez has come in his place. It remains to be seen just what effect this will have on the side and against Real Madrid, it will be a baptism of fire of sorts for the young tactician.
    • Real Madrid will be hungry to return to winning ways after their frustrating and controversial draw away at Osasuna. With Barcelona and Atletico Madrid marching on at the top of the table, every weekend represents three vital points that Carlo Ancelotti's side have to take away in order to keep their La Liga hopes alive.
    • Carlo Ancelotti will have to play Nacho at centre half given the absences of Pepe and Raphael Varane and his inexperience is something Valencia will try to exploit. However, elsewhere Madrid will be at full strength and given Valencia's inconsistency this year, in addition to this week's dramas, they will be strong favourites to come away with all the spoils.
    • If recent results in this fixture are anything to go by - there has been 24 goals scored in the last four meetings between these two sides at the Mestalla - goals are certain. As ever, Ronaldo will be aiming to be amongst them too, especially after he strangely fired blanks last weekend.
